content.taskInstructions:
Instructions


Enumerate employee emails.

Import Note: This script is broken at the moment due to updates to one of the libraries. It will return to REQUIRED status once fixes have been applied to the code, but for not DO NOT USE this. Alternatively, you can use the manual method outlined below.

Variation: Manual


1. Query Google to find the company's ZoomInfo page. A sample query is shown below:
site:zoominfo.com/c/ "Patriot Growth Insurance Services"

2. You should be able to find a company page that looks similar to the following URL (note the "/c/" part of the URL):
https://www.zoominfo.com/c/patriot-growth-insurance-services-llc/416005685

3. Click the "Find more contacts" link on the right side of the company's profile page.
4. Using the mouse, highlight the table of employee information, right-click, and copy it. Paste the information into a text file. Use the paging links at the bottom of the page to page to the next table of results and continue to add to the text file. When complete, the text file should look similar to this:
$ head -n 25 names.txt
profile photo for Valentina Miniscalco
Valentina Miniscalco
emailEmail
directDirect
HR Assistant
United States, Pennsylvania, Fort Washington
6/14/2022
profile photo for Josh Wang
Josh Wang
emailEmail
directDirect
Information Technology Support
United States, Pennsylvania, Fort Washington
6/14/2022
profile photo for Gregory Hancock
Gregory Hancock
emailEmail
directDirect
-
United States, Pennsylvania, Fort Washington
6/14/2022
profile photo for Jesse Velichko
Jesse Velichko
emailEmail
directDirect

5. Using awk, extract the names from the text file:
$ awk '/profile/{getline; print}' names.txt
Valentina Miniscalco
Josh Wang
Gregory Hancock
Jesse Velichko
Bryan Leuszler
Amber Anderson
Tammy Cameron
...

6. Finally, copy the info into a text editor, replace the space characters with a tab character, and then copy the data into Excel. You should end up with two columns, one with the first name and one with the last name. Use Excel formulas to change the data into the correct email address format desired. An example of formatting John Smith into a jsmith@domain.com email address is shown below:
=LOWER(CONCAT(LEFT(TRIM(A1),1),TRIM(B1),"@domain.com"))

Variation: Zoominfo-scraper.py


1. Download the zoominfo script. Github has instructions on setting up and using.
https://github.com/NetSPI/OSINT/tree/master/Zoominfo

2. Google dork your target "domain.com" like so:
site:zoominfo.com domain.com

3. Pick the correct instance (usually the first) and give the script everything after "https://www.zoominfo.com/c/" as -z, e.g.,
-z 'netspi-inc/36078304'

There are three format (-f) options:
  1. flast@domain.tld (e.g., jdoe@netspi.com) (default)

  2. first.last@domain.tld (e.g., john.doe@netspi.com)

  3. Full name (e.g., John Marie Doe)


4. Run the script.
python3 zoominfo-scraper.py -z zoominfo/path (-d domain.tld) (-f 2)

Report Verification


Please add the discovered email addresses to a list provided as an auxiliary deliverable to the client.

masterFinding.verificationInstructions:
Instructions

https://github.com/NetSPI/OSINT/tree/master/Zoominfo

Github has instructions on setting up and using. Quick instructions for reference after setup:

python3 zoominfo-scraper.py -z zoominfo/path [-d domain.tld] [-f 2] [-o output-filename.txt]

Google dork your target "domain.com" like so:

site:zoominfo.com domain.com


Pick the correct instance (usually the first) and give the script everything after "https://www.zoominfo.com/c/" as -z, e.g.,

-z 'netspi-inc/36078304'


There are four format (-f) options:
  1. flast@domain.tld (e.g., jdoe@netspi.com) (default)

  2. first.last@domain.tld (e.g., john.doe@netspi.com)

  3. lastf@domain.com (e.g., doej@netspi.com)

  4. Full name (e.g., John Marie Doe)



Report Verification

Please add this finding to the workspace and add the discovered email addresses as a verification item.

Additional Notes

None
masterFinding.name: Employee - ZoomInfo
masterFinding.description:
Import Note: This script is broken at the moment due to updates to one of the libraries. It will return to REQUIRED status once fixes have been applied to the code, but for not DO NOT USE this. Alternatively, you can use the manual method outlined below.


Manual Method

Instructions

Query Google to find the company's ZoomInfo page. A sample query is shown below:
site:zoominfo.com/c/ "Patriot Growth Insurance Services"


You should be able to find a company page that looks similar to the following URL (note the "/c/" part of the URL):
https://www.zoominfo.com/c/patriot-growth-insurance-services-llc/416005685


Click the "Find more contacts" link on the right side of the company's profile page.

Using the mouse, highlight the table of employee information, right-click, and copy it. Paste the information into a text file. Use the paging links at the bottom of the page to page to the next table of results and continue to add to the text file. When complete, the text file should look similar to this:
$ head -n 25 names.txt
profile photo for Valentina Miniscalco
Valentina Miniscalco
emailEmail
directDirect
HR Assistant
United States, Pennsylvania, Fort Washington
6/14/2022
profile photo for Josh Wang
Josh Wang
emailEmail
directDirect
Information Technology Support
United States, Pennsylvania, Fort Washington
6/14/2022
profile photo for Gregory Hancock
Gregory Hancock
emailEmail
directDirect
-
United States, Pennsylvania, Fort Washington
6/14/2022
profile photo for Jesse Velichko
Jesse Velichko
emailEmail
directDirect


Using awk, extract the names from the text file:
$ awk '/profile/{getline; print}' names.txt
Valentina Miniscalco
Josh Wang
Gregory Hancock
Jesse Velichko
Bryan Leuszler
Amber Anderson
Tammy Cameron
...


Finally, copy the info into a text editor, replace the space characters with a tab character, and then copy the data into Excel. You should end up with two columns, one with the first name and one with the last name. Use Excel formulas to change the data into the correct email address format desired. An example of formatting John Smith into a jsmith@domain.com email address is shown below:
=LOWER(CONCAT(LEFT(TRIM(A1),1),TRIM(B1),"@domain.com"))



Automated Method (Currently Broken)

Instructions

https://github.com/NetSPI/OSINT/tree/master/Zoominfo

Github has instructions on setting up and using. Quick instructions for reference after setup:

python3 zoominfo-scraper.py -z zoominfo/path (-d domain.tld) (-f 2)

Google dork your target "domain.com" like so:

site:zoominfo.com domain.com


Pick the correct instance (usually the first) and give the script everything after "https://www.zoominfo.com/c/" as -z, e.g.,

-z 'netspi-inc/36078304'


There are three format (-f) options:
  1. flast@domain.tld (e.g., jdoe@netspi.com) (default)

  2. first.last@domain.tld (e.g., john.doe@netspi.com)

  3. Full name (e.g., John Marie Doe)




Report Verification

Please add the discovered email addresses to a list provided as an auxiliary deliverable to the client.

Additional Notes

None
